intro: Arracacia irazuensis, commonly known as the Irazú arracacha, is a herbaceous plant native to Costa Rica. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
